column4: is there a way to have ubuntu show me live hardware changed in my computer?
*changes
this is diagnostics.
I am on windows right now, and some electronic devices in my room are causing my computer to beep beep as if there is a hardware change
I am boggling my mind trying to figure out what piece of hardware is flickering or changing
wonder if ubuntu would log that
well, the standard windows "doo doo"
like when you plug in a usb device
but I see nothing showing me WHY it's doing that.
the only thing i can think of is doing lshw everytime, compare the lists to see if there is a change
if that is the case then it certainly is a windows issue
if I boot into ubuntu and replicate the issue, will you guys support me then? :|
we can only help with ubuntu issues, this sounds like a windows issue
sounds like a windows driver issue to me
surely only devices plugged into the computer will affect it
nope.
you don't have any giant magnets or stong signaling equipment?
why on earth do you suspect an aquarium pump?
because when I plug in my aquarium pump my computer detects a hardware change
when in windows?
what is a power conditioner?
